Dialogues: In hydrogen, orbitals have different energies depending on their n. The higher the n, the higher the energy.
These energies are quantized, or not continuous.
Light is a form of energy.
When the electron receives light, it can transform from a wave with a lower n to one with a higher n.
Look at l. Transitions can happen only when the two ls have a difference of 1.
In other words, an angular node must appear or disappear.
Now, let’s look at a different transformation.
It’s going from a higher n to a lower n. This means that it will release energy, in the form of light, instead of receiving.
The emission and absorption spectra are from these transformations.
